info.description:
The pager service implements all pager functions for GroupAlarm

# Authentication

<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->
info.title: groupalarm Pager API

get.description: Returns all pagers for current user or given organization

200.description: pager configurations for passed user or organization

items.description: A Pager represents a pager configuration

active.description: true, if this configuration can be used for alarm notifications

name.description: user defined name for this configuration

status.description: PublicPagerStatusResponse is used to remove critical information from a PagerStatusResponse

battery.description: PagerStatusBattery contains information about the pager's battery

status.description: BatteryStatus is a custom int representing the status of a pager's battery

version.description: PagerStatusVersion contains information about the pager's soft- and hardware versions

post.description: Create a pager configuration in the given organization

schema.description: A Pager represents a pager configuration

active.description: true, if this configuration can be used for alarm notifications

name.description: user defined name for this configuration

status.description: PublicPagerStatusResponse is used to remove critical information from a PagerStatusResponse

battery.description: PagerStatusBattery contains information about the pager's battery

status.description: BatteryStatus is a custom int representing the status of a pager's battery

version.description: PagerStatusVersion contains information about the pager's soft- and hardware versions

400.description: pager configuration payload is missing or in wrong format

schema.description: A PagerCreationRequest is used to create a new pager

active.description: true, if this configuration can be used for alarm notifications

name.description: user defined name for this configuration

status.description: BatteryStatus is a custom int representing the status of a pager's battery

version.description: PagerStatusVersion contains information about the pager's soft- and hardware versions

delete.description: Remove a pager from the given organization

parameters.description: ID of an existing pager configuration

400.description: passed pagerID / organization_id missing or in wrong format

post.description: Set a pager as personal device of the given user

parameters.description: ID of an existing pager configuration
parameters.name: pagerID

400.description: passed pagerID / userID missing or in wrong format

403.description: organization is not allowed to assign this pager

get.description: Returns whether the given organization has disabled this way of alarming or not

200.description: whether this way of alarming is disabled or not

items.description: IsDisabled is the request and response of requests via the api

400.description: organization_id is missing or in wrong format

put.description: Sets whether the given organization has this way of alarming disabled or not

400.description: organization_id is missing or in wrong format

schema.description: IsDisabled is the request and response of requests via the api

post.description: Force a pager to init itself again

403.description: user or organization are not allowed to manage pager

schema.description: A PagerRequest is required to implement Format() to create a HMSgr-compatible message

post.description: Lock the pager and prevent any further use

403.description: user or organization are not allowed to manage pager

schema.description: A PagerRequest is required to implement Format() to create a HMSgr-compatible message

post.description: Force a pager to reset (to default settings)

403.description: user or organization are not allowed to manage pager

schema.description: A PagerRequestReset is a pager management request to reset the pager (to factory settings)

factoryReset.description: set to true if the pager should reset to factory default settings

organizationId.description: organization, which is managing this pager

post.description: Request a status update from the pager

403.description: user or organization are not allowed to manage pager

schema.description: A PagerRequest is required to implement Format() to create a HMSgr-compatible message

post.description: Send the given text like an alarm onto the pager's display

schema.description: A PagerRequestTextAlarm is a pager management request to display a text (like an alarm) on the display

organizationId.description: organization, which is managing this pager

403.description: user or organization are not allowed to manage pager

schema.description: A PagerRequestTextDisplay is a pager management request to display a text on the display

organizationId.description: organization, which is managing this pager

post.description: Unlock the pager and allow usage

schema.description: A PagerRequest is required to implement Format() to create a HMSgr-compatible message

API_Token.description: To use this API, you need an API-Token from the RBAC settings of your GroupAlarm organization. Place the token inside the HTTP-Header `API-Token` for every request, otherwise the API will return an "401 Unauthorized" error for your request.
API_Token.name: API-TOKEN

Personal-Access-Token.description: To use this API, you need a Personal Access Token from your profile settings. Place the token inside the HTTP-Header `Personal-Access-Token` for every request, otherwise the API will return an "401 Unauthorized" error for your request.
Personal-Access-Token.name: Personal-Access-Token

AccessAllowedResponse.description: AccessAllowedResponse contains whether the organization allows access or not

Alarm.description: Alarm contains all required information to create an alarm on our pager

priority.description: AlarmPriority is a custom int representing the priority of an alarm

AlarmAddition.description: AlarmAddition contains all required information to create a piece of additional information for an alarm

AlarmCreationRequest.description: This is used for an alarm creation
AlarmCreationRequest.title: AlarmCreationRequest defines an alarm creation payload

eventName.description: Name of an event; if event name is passed, a new event will be created with the passed name

items.description: This is used for an alarm creation
items.title: AlarmCreationRequestLabel defines an alarm creation label payload

optionalContent.description:
PropertyMap is used as container for additional data in alarms or messages
it can be stored and retrieved easily in our Postgres database

organizationID.description: ID of the organization to create the alarm as

AlarmCreationRequestLabel.description: This is used for an alarm creation
AlarmCreationRequestLabel.title: AlarmCreationRequestLabel defines an alarm creation label payload

AlarmID.description: AlarmID contains the id of an alarm

AlarmList.description: This is used for an alarm creation
AlarmList.title: AlarmList defines an alarm list payload

items.description: Alarm contains all required information to create an alarm on our pager

priority.description: AlarmPriority is a custom int representing the priority of an alarm

totalAlarms.description: amount of alarms inside the payload

AlarmPreview.description: This is used for an alarm-scenario preview
AlarmPreview.title: AlarmPreview defines the alarm preview payload

items.description: Position represents a position in the alarm that is fulfilled by a user

positionsFulfilled.description: indicates that the alarm positions in this preview are fulfilled

AlarmPriority.description: AlarmPriority is a custom int representing the priority of an alarm

AlarmResponse.description: AlarmResponse is created if an alarm was answered by user

AlarmService.description: AlarmService defines all required methods to interact with alarms

AlarmShownResponse.description: AlarmShownResponse is created if an alarm was shown on pager display

AlarmStatusOverview.description: Definition of an alarm status overview

items.description: Definition of a single alarmed device

AlarmStatusOverviewDevice.description: Definition of a single alarmed device

AlarmTemplate.description: AlarmTemplate defines an alarm template payload

BatteryStatus.description: BatteryStatus is a custom int representing the status of a pager's battery

DisabledOrganizationsService.description: DisabledOrganizationsService describes all methods used to organizations which have disabled this kind of alarming

delay.description: configured delay in seconds, when escalation is used after the last one

wayofalarm.description: type of the alarming way e.g. email

EscalationConfiguration.description: Definition of an escalation configuration payload

delay.description: configured delay in seconds, when escalation is used after the last one

wayofalarm.description: type of the alarming way e.g. email

organizationID.description: organization id for editing escalation as an organization administrator

userID.description: assigned user for this escalation configuration for organization administrator editing

escalationTier.description: current escalation tier for this message beginning at 0

maxEscalationTier.description: max escalation tier for this message

Event.description: Event is a custom int representing a event

endDate.description: time where this event was closed

name.description: user given name for this event

scheduledEndtime.description: time this event is scheduled for close

EventCreationItem.description: EventCreationItem is used by the different services to create a new audit-log item

EventList.description: This is used for the event list with pagination
EventList.title: EventList describes an eventlist payload

items.description: Event is a custom int representing a event

endDate.description: time where this event was closed

name.description: user given name for this event

scheduledEndtime.description: time this event is scheduled for close

EventListItem.description: An EventListItem is used as a single audit-log entry in an EventList

user.description: User is a basic copy of user-service's PublicUser

EventService.description: EventService defines all methods for the event handling

Feature.description: Feature contains all information about a single feature

FeatureIntegration.description: FeatureIntegration contains all data used to integrate our shop with all other services

FeatureRegistryService.description: FeatureRegistryService provides all functions needed to manage a feature registry

FeedbackPercentage.description: FeedbackPercentage describes the percentage of an alarm feedback

IsDisabled.description: IsDisabled is the request and response of requests via the api

Label.description: This is used for the interaction with alarms
Label.title: Label describes a label payload

name.description: name of this label

LabelService.description: LabelService defines all required methods to interact with labels

LabelStrength.description: This payload connects labels with an amount of user for a strength
LabelStrength.title: LabelStrength describes a strength payload

amount.description: amount of strength members for a specific alarm

name.description: Name for this role

items.description: This is used for user to role assignment
items.title: Definition of a user-role payload

OperationalEvent.description: OperationalEvent is a custom int representing a event

OrganizationService.description: OrganizationService provides all functions needed to check for expired accesses to organizations

Pager.description: A Pager represents a pager configuration

active.description: true, if this configuration can be used for alarm notifications

name.description: user defined name for this configuration

status.description: PublicPagerStatusResponse is used to remove critical information from a PagerStatusResponse

PagerLock.description: PagerLock is used to force our pager to lock itself

PagerManagementController.description: A PagerManagementController handles all requests going to a HMsgr from our cluster about pager management

PagerService.description: The PagerService interface describes all functions we have to implement

PagerRequest.description: A PagerRequest is required to implement Format() to create a HMSgr-compatible message

PagerRequestReset.description: A PagerRequestReset is a pager management request to reset the pager (to factory settings)

factoryReset.description: set to true if the pager should reset to factory default settings

organizationId.description: organization, which is managing this pager

PagerRequestTextAlarm.description: A PagerRequestTextAlarm is a pager management request to display a text (like an alarm) on the display

organizationId.description: organization, which is managing this pager

PagerRequestTextDisplay.description: A PagerRequestTextDisplay is a pager management request to display a text on the display

organizationId.description: organization, which is managing this pager

PagerReset.description: PagerReset is used to force our pager to reset itself to factory default settings

PagerService.description: The PagerService interface describes all functions we have to implement

PagerStatistics.description: PagerStatistics contains all statistics about pagers in an organization

PagerStatisticsController.description: A PagerStatisticsController handles all requests about pager statistics

PagerStatisticsService.description: The PagerStatisticsService interface describes all functions we have to implement
The PagerStatisticsService interface describes all functions we have to implement

version.description: PagerStatusVersion contains information about the pager's soft- and hardware versions

PagerUnlock.description: PagerUnlock is used to force our pager to unlock itself again

PagerUpdate.description: PagerUpdate is used to force our pager to update it's firmware

PagerUserStatusChange.description: PagerUserStatusChange is created if a pager sent a user status update (login / logout)

userStatus.description: UserStatus is a custom int representing the status of a user

Position.description: Position represents a position in the alarm that is fulfilled by a user

additionalProperties.description: PositionCount contains the amount and actual count of a position

PostgresAlarmService.description:
PostgresAlarmService implements the methods of the AlarmService
and contains all required resources

EventService.description: EventService defines all methods for the event handling

FeatureIntegration.description: FeatureIntegration contains all data used to integrate our shop with all other services

LabelService.description: LabelService defines all required methods to interact with labels

ScenarioService.description: ScenarioService defines all required methods for interacting with scenarios

UserStatusService.description: UserStatusService describes all methods we have to implement

PostgresLabelService implements all methods of the LabelService

PostgresUnitService implements all methods of the UnitService

PropertyMap is used as container for additional data in alarms or messages
it can be stored and retrieved easily in our Postgres database

name.description: Name for this role

Scenario.description: Scenario contains all values of a scenario payload

description.description: user given description for this scenario

instructionCatalogID.description: possible id of an instruction catalog

name.description: user given name for this scenario

sendPosition.description: send position to users after alarm is closed

units.description: all units by their ID in an array

ScenarioCreationRequest.description: ScenarioCreationRequest contains the a creation request of a scenario

description.description: user given description for this scenario

instructionCatalogID.description: possible id of an instruction catalog

name.description: user given name for this scenario

sendPosition.description: send position to users after alarm is closed

units.description: all units by their ID in an array

ScenarioService.description: ScenarioService defines all required methods for interacting with scenarios

Service.description: This is used for service interaction
Service.title: Definition of a service payload

name.description: Name of this service/endpoint

Shift.description: Shift describes the intervals of a shift and the assigned users all user defined parameters

ShiftSchedule.description: ShiftSchedule contains meta-information about the schedule and multiple shifts

items.description: Shift describes the intervals of a shift and the assigned users all user defined parameters

ShiftScheduleService.description: ShiftScheduleService defines all methods used to manage shift schedules

Strength.description: This is used for the strength interaction
Strength.title: Strength describes the strength payload

amount.description: amount of strength members for a specific alarm

labelStrengths.description: label with amount for this strength

StrengthConfig.description: StrengthConfig describes a strength configuration payload

labels.description: assigned label ids for this rank

SupportAgentResponse.description: SupportAgentResponse contains whether the user is a support agent or not

SupportAgentService.description: SupportAgentService provides all functions needed to manage support agents

SupportOrganization.description: SupportOrganization represents a single organization and the timestamp when it allowed support agents to access it

SupportOrganizationList.description: A SupportOrganizationList contains multiple SupportOrganizations and a TotalSupportOrganization count used for pagination

items.description: SupportOrganization represents a single organization and the timestamp when it allowed support agents to access it

TXExit.description: TXExit is sent from the HMsgr to our service as soon as a pager disconnects from it

TXGetList.description: TXGetList requests a list of available pagers from the connected HMsgr

TXGetPollTab.description: TXGetPollTab requests a more detailed list of available pagers from the connected HMsgr

TXInit.description: TXInit is sent from the HMsgr to our service as soon as a pager connects with it

TXPEntry.description: A TXPEntry describes the status of a single pager

status.description: TXPEntryStatus is a custom int representing the status of a pager

TXPEntryStatus.description: TXPEntryStatus is a custom int representing the status of a pager

TXPing.description: TXPing is sent from the HMsgr to our service and has to be answered with a TXPong

TXPong.description: TXPong is sent from our service to the HMsgr as an answer to it's TXPing

Text.description: Text contains all required information to create a text message on our pager

Token.description: This is used for token interaction
Token.title: Definition of a token payload

name.description: Name for this token

TokenRequest.description: This is used for creation of tokens

name.description: Name for this token
